byline.original: By ROBERT P. GEORGE and MELISSA MOSCHELLA

abstract: Op-Ed article by Princeton University professors Robert P George and Melissa Moschella challenges newly mandated sex-education classes that are part of New York City schools chancellor Dennis M Walcott's recommended middle-school curriculum; charges that the mandate undermines parental rights and he insists that families be given the choice to opt out.
snippet: Should the government force parents to send their children to classes that may contradict their moral and religious values?
lead_paragraph: Should the government force parents to send their children to classes that may contradict their moral and religious values?

headline.main: Does Sex Ed Undermine Parental Rights?
headline.print_headline: Does Sex Ed Undermine Parental Rights?
